title: Update needed in javadoc for constructor Image(Device, ImageData)
description: The constructor for Image(Device, ImageData) in the SWT library may throw an org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth, but this is not documented in the javadoc. This issue should be addressed to improve clarity for developers.
OB: The constructor for Image(Device, ImageData) can also throw org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth.
EB: The javadoc for the constructor Image(Device, ImageData) should be updated to mention that it can throw an org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth when the color depth is unsupported. This update will help developers understand the potential exception that may be raised when using this constructor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue and verify the absence of documentation, you can create a simple Java program like the following: 

1. Import the necessary SWT library: import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.
2. Create a Java class, for example, TestImageInvalidImage.
3. Inside the main method of the class, initialize an ImageData with unsupported color depth: ImageData data = new ImageData(10, 10, 1, new PaletteData(0xff0000, 0x00ff00, 0x0000ff));
4. Attempt to create an Image using the constructor in question: Image image = new Image(Display.getDefault(), data);
5. Ensure that the program is compiled and executed.
6. Observe whether an org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Unsupported color depth is thrown during the execution, indicating the issue with the constructor documentation.
